citeinfo.title: Historic Residential Per Capita Demand - Twin Cities Metropolitan Area, Minnesota

descript.abstract: This dataset contains historic residential per capita water demand for 2004, 2005, and 2006 for each municipal water supply system in the Twin Cities metropolitan area. Data was compiled by the Metropolitan Council from Minnesota Department of Natural Resources supplemental water use information submitted annually by municipal water utilities.
descript.purpose: The 2005 Minnesota Legislature directed the Metropolitan Council to "carry out planning activities addressing the water supply needs of the metropolitan area" (Minnesota Statutes, Section 473.1565). Specifically the Council is charged with developing a base of technical information for water supply planning decisions and to prepare a metropolitan area master water supply plan. This dataset supports this charge.
descript.supplinf: Twin Cities Seven County Metropolitan Area. This includes the counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington in Minnesota.

timeperd.current: Data is considered complete through 2005. Some 2006 data had not yet been reported at the time the data was compiled (August 2008). Changes since 2006 only reflect minor adjustments to the municipal boundaries, reflected in the Time Period of Content.

place.placekey: Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County

theme.themekey: public water supply, residential demand, per capita

idinfo.useconst: By acceptance of this data, the user agrees to include a copy of the metadata record, including the liability disclaimer, whenever the user transmits or provides the GIS data (or any portion of it) to another user.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.1.1332

citeinfo.title: Public Water Supply System Demand Projections; Municipal Water Supply System Status

cntinfo.cntpos: Sr. Environmental Scientist, Water Supply Planning

attracc.attraccr: The accuracy of reported per capita residential water demand varies between public water supply systems depending on the accuracy of water metering and annual estimates of residential population.

dataqual.complete: Each community in the seven county geographic area is covered.

procstep.procdesc:
DATA SOURCES:
- Minnesota Department of Natural Resources

overview.eaover:
PSW_ID - Minnesota Department of Health Minnesota Drinking Water Information System public water supplier identification number
CTU_NAME - Metropolitan Council community name
ResGPCD_04 - 2004 residential per capita daily water use (gallons/person/day), as reported to the Minnesota Department of Natural Resource by municipal water suppliers as supplemental water use information associated with water appropriation permit reporting.
ResGPCD_05 - 2005 residential per capita daily water use (gallons/person/day), as reported to the Minnesota Department of Natural Resource by municipal water suppliers as supplemental water use information associated with water appropriation permit reporting.
ResGPCD_06 - 2006 residential per capita daily water use (gallons/person/day), as reported to the Minnesota Department of Natural Resource by municipal water suppliers as supplemental water use information associated with water appropriation permit reporting.
